headline: FuriosaAI Turns Down Meta's $800M Bid To Go Rogue With RNGD, As AI Chip War Between Nvidia, Google, And Meta Heats Up
summary: South Korean AI hardware startup FuriosaAI has made waves in the global semiconductor industry after reportedly turning down an $800 million acquisition offer from Meta (NASDAQ:META). The decision shows the startup's ambition to remain independent and compete directly in the rapidly evolving AI chip market dominated by NVIDIA (NASDAQ:NVDA) and increasingly encroached on by tech giants like Alphabet (NASDAQ:GOOGL, GOOG)) and Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT). headline: Meta's antitrust case, retail sales, housing data: What to Watch
summary: Here's what investors are watching during the week of April 14 to April 18. Meta Platforms (META) is set to face the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) as part of its antitrust case. Investors will get fresh economic data, including retail sales and Federal Reserve commentary. Homebuilder confidence, as well as starts and permits data, will offer insights into the housing market. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime here.

headline: Meta to add Dina Powell McCormick, Patrick Collison to board
summary: Powell McCormick, who spent 16 years in senior leadership roles at Goldman Sachs, has previously served as deputy national security adviser to U.S. President Donald Trump in his first term.  She has also served as a senior White House adviser and as assistant secretary of state for Condoleezza Rice under President George W. Bush.

headline: Meta antitrust trial: Everything you need to know
summary: Meta (META) is heading to court in Washington, DC, to defend itself against the Federal Trade Commission's claim that the tech giant is illegally dominating the personal social media market. Yahoo Finance Senior Legal Reporter Alexis Keenan joins Catalysts to discuss the high stakes of the case, including the potential forced divestiture of Instagram and WhatsApp. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Catalysts here.

headline: Should You Buy Meta Platforms Stock Before April 30?
summary: Meta Platforms (NASDAQ: META) is the parent company of social networks including Facebook, Instagram, Messenger, and WhatsApp, which serve more than 3.3 billion people every single day.  The company is coming off of a spectacular year of earnings growth in 2024, and it's scheduled to report its financial results for the first quarter of 2025 (ended March 31) on April 30.  Investors can expect to learn more about Meta's growing portfolio of artificial intelligence (AI) initiatives, which are powering brand-new features and helping the company target users with relevant content more effectively.
